Subjective: Fatigue for 2 months; superficial sleep; morning stiffness; muscle pain; back pain; waking up with a start (once a week). No fever, no headache, no cough, no shortness of breath. Unable to do daily activities with enthusiasm; impact on work and sports. Request: Wants to rule out underlying conditions; concerned about rheumatism or arthritis. No smoking; regular exercise (climbing, cycling).
Objective: BP: 110/60; HR: 40-60; lungs sound fine; abdomen: lively peristalsis, no pain or tenderness. Back: some tenderness on palpation; neck and shoulder muscles: no pain or stiffness.
Assessment: Fatigue of unknown cause; possible superficial sleep disorder; morning stiffness and muscle pain; back pain. No clear indications for rheumatoid arthritis or other inflammatory conditions.
Plan: Blood tests: anemia, thyroid function, inflammation. Follow-up phone appointment to discuss results and next steps. Patient will receive test form in inbox and schedule appointment at Atal Medial.
